title: Playing against Qiyana and Pyke in the same game today made me think...
body:
"Should i actually sell {{item:3047}} and buy {{item:3111}} ?"
That's the moment when i was completely sure, if there was any doubt before, how stupid modern assassin's design is. You've given too much cc to champions who are just supposed to dance in and out of fight for burst damage, not stun locking people in place for seconds while losing nothing of the above.

This is pathetic and horrible design, and i honestly feel bad for anyone who approved it because it shows how incompetent and bad at their job they are.

replies.body:
So because you had to itemize against cc you came to the conclusion that pyke has a stupid design?

I mean yea dude youre right, I mean, counter building against damage, cc? PFFFF what a dumb thing to do, it must be just a bad champ design {{sticker:sg-miss-fortune}}
I had to buy {{item:3009}} against Nasus, which makes him terrible design. /s
I have to buy Bramble Vest against him so I don't lose laning phase after a certain number of stacks. He is obviously terrible design. /s
And can you *believe* I had to buy MR against Corki? He's an ADC! I should only ever have to buy armor against them and nothing else!
I know. It's almost as bad as me having to buy Randuin's just because the enemy team has a Tryndamere and a Yasuo. I should only have to build Dead Man's for armor.
Pyke is a support. He's suppose to have CC

> [{quoted}](name=BlackKnightJack,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ei1KAhZK,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-08-16T15:11:09.973+0000)
>
> Pyke is a support. He's suppose to have CC

Of course, then why does he have burst and an high true damage execute while losing no mobility at all?

His damage isn't really quite as impressive as you seem to think. The next time you're in a game with Pyke look at how much damage he does to champions in the post game stats. You'll be surprised at how low it actually is.
Really the only time Pyke’s damage is dangerous is when his execution comes into play. And that’s less him doing a lot of damage and more his execution ratio being high.
